title: The Lord Brings His Power against (Spiritual) Babylon
html:
2 Nephi 23:6. "The day of the Lord" As noted earlier, there are many days of the Lord, which are days of judgment appointed by God, and the Second Coming is also referred to as the Day of the Lord.

2 Nephi 23:7. "Heart[s] shall melt" This phrase reminds us of other scriptures that speak of men's hearts "failing" them in the last days (see Moses 7:66; Luke 21:26; D&C 45:26).

2 Nephi 23:8. "Faces shall be as flames" This may describe faces flushed with shame and guilt, or faces witnessing the burning at the Second Coming.

2 Nephi 23:9. "Wrath and fierce anger" A very sobering description of the God of justice doing His work, but the Lord's judgments come only after repeated invitations to repent are ignored.

2 Nephi 23:10. "The sun shall be darkened" Strange signs and wonders in the heavens will signal that the Second Coming is near (see also D&C 45:42).

2 Nephi 23:12. "More precious than fine gold" "Precious" in this context means rare or scarce. Many people will be destroyed in the events preceding Jesus' Second Coming, such that men will be few and far between, and as rare as the "golden wedge of Ophir," a place renowned for the purity of its gold.
